typeSystemDescription.name: TypeSystem
typeSystemDescription.description: This is a default Type System. It includes general types necessary to store conceptAnnotations in the Annotation DB and interface with Protege

typeDescription.name: edu.ucdenver.ccp.knowtator.uima.conceptAnnotation.CCPDocumentInformation
typeDescription.description: The CCPDocumentInformation conceptAnnotation includes document metadata such as the document ID, document collection ID, secondary document IDs, document size, etc.

featureDescription.name: documentID
featureDescription.description: The document ID is a String representing a unique identifier for a particular document within a particular document collection.

featureDescription.name: documentCollectionID
featureDescription.description: The document collection ID is an Integer that uniquely identifies a particular document collection.

featureDescription.name: documentSize
featureDescription.description: The size of a document is logged as the number of characters it contains.

featureDescription.name: secondaryDocumentIDs
featureDescription.description: This StringArray is used for secondary document ID storage. For example, in the biomedical domain, a particular document might be associated with a PubMed ID, however it might also have a deprecated Medline ID, or perhaps a PubMed Central ID, either of which could be stored in this StringArray. It is recommended that the type of ID along with the ID itself be stored, e.g. "MedlineID:12345".

featureDescription.name: classificationType
featureDescription.description: This String provides a means for classifying a particular document.

typeDescription.name: edu.ucdenver.ccp.knowtator.uima.conceptAnnotation.CCPTextAnnotation
typeDescription.description: The CCP TextAnnotation extends the base conceptAnnotation class to include an conceptAnnotation ID, the capability for multiple conceptAnnotation spans, a link to the annotator responsible for generating the conceptAnnotation, membership to conceptAnnotation sets, and a link to a class mention which defines the class of this conceptAnnotation.

featureDescription.name: annotationID
featureDescription.description: The conceptAnnotation ID provides a means for identifying a particular conceptAnnotation. Setting this ID is optional. The default value should be -1.

featureDescription.name: annotator
featureDescription.description: The annotator was responsible for generating this conceptAnnotation.

featureDescription.name: documentSectionID
featureDescription.description: The document section ID is optionally used to log what section of a document this conceptAnnotation is from. Values can be specified by the user. See edu.uchsc.ccp.util.nlp.document.DocumentSectionTypes for a few common sections.

featureDescription.name: annotationSets
featureDescription.description: Annotation Sets provide an arbitrary means of categorizing and clustering conceptAnnotations into groups.

featureDescription.name: numberOfSpans
featureDescription.description: The number of spans comprising this conceptAnnotation. The CCP TextAnnotation allows the use of multiple spans for a single conceptAnnotation.

featureDescription.name: spans
featureDescription.description: This FSArray stores the CCPSpans which comprise this conceptAnnotation. It should be noted that for an conceptAnnotation with multiple spans, the default begin and end fields are set to the beginning of the first span and the end of the final span, respectively.

featureDescription.name: owlClass
featureDescription.description: The CCP Class indicates the type (or class) for this conceptAnnotation.

typeDescription.name: edu.ucdenver.ccp.knowtator.uima.mention.CCPClassMention
typeDescription.description: The CCP ClassMention is the root of a flexible class structure that can be used to store virtually any frame-based representation of a particular class. Common class mention types include, but are not limited to, such things as entities (protein, cell type, cell line, disease, tissue, etc.) and frames (interaction, transport, regulation, etc.).

featureDescription.name: slotMentions
featureDescription.description: A class mention optionally has slot mentions which represent attributes of that class. These slot mentions are stored in the slotMentions FSArray. There are two types of slot mentions, complex and non-complex. The difference between complex and non-complex slot mentions is simply the type of filler (or slot value) for each. Complex slot mentions are filled with a class mention, whereas non-complex slot mentions are filled by simple Strings.

featureDescription.name: ccpTextAnnotation
featureDescription.description: Just as CCPTextAnnotations are linked to a CCPClassMention, it is sometimes useful to be able to follow a CCPClassMention back to its corresponding CCPTextAnnotation.

typeDescription.name: edu.ucdenver.ccp.knowtator.uima.conceptAnnotation.CCPAnnotation
typeDescription.description: The superclass for all CCP conceptAnnotations.

featureDescription.name: annotationMetadata
featureDescription.description: Stores metadata for an conceptAnnotation.

typeDescription.name: edu.ucdenver.ccp.knowtator.uima.mention.CCPComplexSlotMention
typeDescription.description: A slot mention is deemed "complex" when its slot filler is a class mention as opposed to a String (See non-complex slot mention for String fillers). An example of a complex slot mention is the "transported entity" slot for the protein-transport class which would be filled with a protein class mention.

featureDescription.name: classMentions
featureDescription.description: The class mentions which are the slot fillers for this complex slot.

typeDescription.name: edu.ucdenver.ccp.knowtator.uima.mention.CCPMention
typeDescription.description: The superclass for all CCP Mentions (class mention, complex slot mention, and non-complex slot mention)

featureDescription.name: mentionName
featureDescription.description: The name of this mention.

typeDescription.name: edu.ucdenver.ccp.knowtator.uima.mention.CCPSlotMention
typeDescription.description: The superclass for all slot mentions (complex and non-complex).

typeDescription.name: edu.ucdenver.ccp.knowtator.uima.conceptAnnotation.CCPSpan
typeDescription.description: The span object holds span information.This is a supplement to the default UIMA conceptAnnotation which cannot handle multi-span conceptAnnotations.

featureDescription.name: spanStart
featureDescription.description: The character offset for the start of the span.

featureDescription.name: spanEnd
featureDescription.description: The character offset for the end of the span.

typeDescription.name: edu.ucdenver.ccp.knowtator.uima.conceptAnnotation.CCPAnnotator
typeDescription.description: The annotator object contains information which is used to determine who/what generated an conceptAnnotation.

featureDescription.name: annotatorID
featureDescription.description: This Integer should be a unique ID for a particular annotator.

featureDescription.name: firstName
featureDescription.description: The first name of the annotator. Use of this field is optional as the annotator ID is primarily used for determining the source of an conceptAnnotation.

featureDescription.name: lastName
featureDescription.description: The last name of the annotator. Use of this field is optional as the annotator ID is primarily used for determining the source of an conceptAnnotation.

featureDescription.name: affiliation
featureDescription.description: The affiliation of the annotator. Use of this field is optional as the annotator ID is primarily used for determining the source of an conceptAnnotation.

typeDescription.name: edu.ucdenver.ccp.knowtator.uima.conceptAnnotation.CCPAnnotationSet
typeDescription.description: The conceptAnnotation set provides a means for arbitrarily categorizing or clustering groups of conceptAnnotations. Annotations can be associated with multiple conceptAnnotation groups. Examples of use include, defining Gold Standard conceptAnnotation sets, and delineating between the use of different parameters during conceptAnnotation, among others. Each conceptAnnotation set is associated with a unique ID, a name and a description.

featureDescription.name: annotationSetID
featureDescription.description: An integer uniquely identifying a particular conceptAnnotation set.

featureDescription.name: annotationSetName
featureDescription.description: The name of the conceptAnnotation set.

featureDescription.name: annotationSetDescription
featureDescription.description: A textual description of an conceptAnnotation set.

typeDescription.name: edu.ucdenver.ccp.knowtator.uima.conceptAnnotation.AnnotationMetadata
typeDescription.description: A class to store conceptAnnotation metadata, provenance, etc.

typeDescription.name: edu.ucdenver.ccp.knowtator.uima.conceptAnnotation.metadata.AnnotationMetadataProperty
typeDescription.description: Superclass for conceptAnnotation metadata properties

typeDescription.name: edu.ucdenver.ccp.knowtator.uima.conceptAnnotation.metadata.AnnotationSetMembershipProperty
typeDescription.description: A metadata property for declaring AnnotationSet membership. This will eventually replace the annotationSets field that is currently part of the CCPTextAnnotation class.

typeDescription.name: edu.ucdenver.ccp.knowtator.uima.conceptAnnotation.metadata.EvaluationResultProperty
typeDescription.description: Superclass for metadata properties describing the result of an evaluation against a gold standard, e.g. TP, FP, FN, etc.

typeDescription.name: edu.ucdenver.ccp.knowtator.uima.conceptAnnotation.metadata.TruePositiveProperty
typeDescription.description: Indicates this conceptAnnotation was scored as a True Positive during an evaluation.

typeDescription.name: edu.ucdenver.ccp.knowtator.uima.conceptAnnotation.metadata.FalsePositiveProperty
typeDescription.description: Indicates that an conceptAnnotation was scored as a False Positive during an evaluation.

typeDescription.name: edu.ucdenver.ccp.knowtator.uima.conceptAnnotation.metadata.GoldStandardSetProperty
typeDescription.description: Indicates that an conceptAnnotation was part of the Gold Standard during an evaluation.

typeDescription.name: edu.ucdenver.ccp.knowtator.uima.conceptAnnotation.metadata.PartialMatchProperty
typeDescription.description: A subclass of False Positive Property. This property is used to indicate an conceptAnnotation that was scored as a False Positive during an evaluation, but is a partial match to the Gold Standard. That is, what is present is correct and the reason it was scored as a False Positive is because it is missing something.

typeDescription.name: edu.ucdenver.ccp.knowtator.uima.conceptAnnotation.metadata.FalseNegativeProperty
typeDescription.description: A subclass of the Gold Standard Property, the False Negative Property indicates a Gold Standard Annotation that was scored as a False Negative during an evaluation.

typeDescription.name: edu.ucdenver.ccp.knowtator.uima.mention.CCPPrimitiveSlotMention
typeDescription.description: An abstract class for grouping all primitive (string, float, boolean, integer) slot mentions.
